Reviews.Title: “Not great.”
Reviews.Author: Akbrennan
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to spend the night before we flew outto Glorida. I picked it specifically because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and the positive comments. The simplest way to describe the hotel is that it's trying to be something it's not. The lobby attempts to be modern and upscale but is filthy. Everything is covered in dust, and garbage sits scattered. Rooms were fine. We had a family room with bunkbeds- great for our son! It is very noisy in the am as planes were flying directly overhead. Room itself was okay- nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay...”
Reviews.Author: ler1
Reviews.Content: We generally book the Sandman while staying near the airport. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. Beds are comfortable, great shower heads too. This hotel seems to be off of the main flight path, or maybe it is better sound-proofed than the others in the area...but the rooms are considerably quieter than the other 'majors' on Dixon Rd. The pool/hot tub area is sufficient, although over-clorinated. The Moxie's that adjoins the hotel is always pleasant and the food....good. The only downfall is that you have to leave the hotel for breakfast. Other than that....its a great stay. The King Suites are really fab. with quite a nice kitchen and living room area at a great price. Sleep tight!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pinky0208
Reviews.Content: Great choice. Near airport. Very nice rooms. Separate living room with TV and desk. Small kitchen with microwave, sink, refrigerator and plates etc.. Very comfortable beds. Overall comfortable clean and nicely appointed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all your typical airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaasond
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sandman a few times when flying out early or coming home late. Nice rooms and great service with rates that are comparable to the "motels" all around the airport in Toronto. Indoor saltwater pool is small but nice and the hot tub is good too. Family suites have bunk beds and a king bed in a separate room. We were upgraded to a Penthouse Suite on our last visit, that was a very nice unit, basically a full one bedroom condo. Front Desk staff are always very pleasant and do whatever they can to make you feel at home. Two weeks parking and free airport shuttle make it almost free to stay there! I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone needing to stay near the airport in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Johnquardt
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this property. I chose this hotel because of its' proximity to the convention centres, kitchenette suites, on-site restaurant (Moxie's), pool and free internet. Although there were a few things lacking attention to detail (burnt out light bulbs, broken remote), overall I was pleased with my experience and will return. In case you don't read the fine print, there is a charge for parking which I was disappionted about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, food and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: katharine b
Reviews.Content: The hotel shuttle was easy to book and reliable and fast. We had a room with a frig and stove and that would be great for people traveling with children who need to be fed before an early morning flight. Moxys Restaurant is in the building and the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “My Toronto Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Msh3ll
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and this will be my hotel from now on when visiting Toronto. I've lived in Toronto and know the area pretty well, I've stayed in another hotel and regretted it so called them that day and they were so welcoming and adjusting to early check-in. I've already booked my July visit for a wedding at this hotel. PERFECT hotel if you want to be close to the airport. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EternityMoment7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family suite with friends for the weekend in July and it was pretty good! I would say this is a solid 4 star hotel. It was a bit smaller than I expected but was still decent. The suite had a master bedroom with 1 king bed, 1 bathroom, kitchenette (microwave, minifridge, sink), and a bunkbed. Beds were comfortable and the room was cleaned daily. It definitely is one of the better airport hotels and wouldn't mind staying there again. I would recommend this place to anyone esp. for business. Internet was reliable and had good connection every time.

Reviews.Title: “Love our King Suite 2x a year!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1444
Reviews.Content: Excellent Food at Moxies, so convenient for dinner & drinks. Great Room Service Great NEW MODERN UPDATED hotel, clean, nice pool & hot tub Will always stay here, quiet and convenient to airport and centers for conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SueFell
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very cheap but we booked it because it had very good reviews. I must say it certainly deserves the good reviews, it was excellent value for money. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the accommodation modern and clean. The attached restaurant served good, reasonably priced food. It is a long way out of Toronto so if you are there to stay in the city it is not ideal, but for a place near the airport to stay before or after a trip it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: conley1234
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with fridge and very comfortable bed. They also offer FREE internet and most rooms are suites. Hotel also has a very nice restaurant attached. Will mark this as a favorite in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: ru7152
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful,clean,modern & roomy. We were upgraded to a suite & had a living room and bedroom. We also booked another room for our son & his family,they were also upgraded. The Hotel is beautiful. I'm sorry that it's only a Canadian hotel chain Since we were flying out the next day we only spent one night there. It's unfortunate that they didn't have a location closer to downtown. We chose to be in the center of Toronto for the bulk of our vacation,since we didn't have a car. If you have transportation you may want to take advantage on what Sandman has to offer. It was a great location for airport & what we needed it for.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget friendly option”
Reviews.Author: BretonFlightCentre
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about 5 hours to take advantage of the airport shuttle. I live in downtown Toronto and found that catching the shuttle from the airport hotel was easier than taking the transit in the early morning. The rate for this hotel was only $111, the rooms were comfortable, clean and spacious. I particularly liked the lobby area. Coming from downtown we only had to take the dixon bus and the hotel was only about a 6 minute walk from the bus stop. The airport shuttle comes every half an hour and it only takes about 15 minutes to get to Pearson airport. It was a nice way to start our vacation stress-free.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice at a great price if staying near Toronto Airport”
Reviews.Author: JoeFonthill
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay compared to other hotels in the area, this one stands apart from the rest of them. We paid $109 for a King room with separate seating area and kitchenette. We upgraded $5 to get the bed and breakfast deal, and they gave us $20 in gift cards for Moxie's Restaurant. Moxie's is nice inside, food is okay, but could be a little better. Service there and in hotel is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: cosenal
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you would want from a hotel by the airport. I stayed there only one night between two flights (they have complementary shuttle service to/from Pearson International airport). Nothing is missing and every detail has been taken care of. Very clean too. I like the fan in the washroom associated to a selection of timer (active for 5-10-15 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: kfremlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the sandman for four nights while travelling for business. It is probably the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at for that price. The lobby is very nicely decorated and the staff are very freindly and helpful. I was upgrated to a suite a no extra cost, which was a very nice surprise. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. The fitness room is good, though there are no free weights. I ate at Moxie's (the restaurant in the hotel) once for dinner and once for breakfast. It is a very busy place. The food was good, but I found breakfast to be a bit pricey. There are several other restaurants within walking distance. It is also within walking distance to the Toronto Congress Centre. There is a free shuttle to/from the airport. I will absolutely stay here again at the next opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice and a great price”
Reviews.Author: Bryan B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and had never been to Toronto before. I was very impressed with the room for the money. Great name too, Sleep great on the nice beds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Start to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bill_in_Guelph
Reviews.Content: Once again we stayed at this hotel the night before flying off on vacation. Once again everything was perfect. The room and bed are great. The rate for the stay and fly is very competitive and shuttle service is efficient. This is the 4th time we've used their facility in Toronto and never been surprised or disappointed. Check-in is quick - everything is ready. At check-in they know you are travelling so ask about wake up and shuttle times. This is an extremely well run organization. A bonus is having a good restaurna tlike Moxie's on premises. Enjoy a good meal and start your holiday already relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern, and super comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Mary L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful with a modern, stylish and comfortable lobby and rooms. The beds were divine. Super comfy, soft, fluffy down comforter. The staff were friendly and helpful. I love that the restaurant is open until 2 am. Good location near the airport, about 20 minutes from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves something to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Mapsv47
Reviews.Content: First impression - unflushed pubic hair and urine in the toilet left with the lid up. Soap still wrapped so they did not wash their hands after. Called desk to ask if my room was secure and advise that someone had been in the room using the toilet and not washing their hands. Expressed concern that the room security and cleanliness may be compromised. Was told that their was probably just chemical left in the toilet and all was just fine. Will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Seanatis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to do a park stay and fly but instead of going to the Holiday Inn we wanted to do something different. The check-in process was good, rooms was really nice with granite counter tops. We also love Moxie's which is located by the hotel lobby. At check-in we setup our shuttle for 02:35 the next morning which seemed very straightforward. We got down to the lobby around 02:15 and sat down. At 02:40 I questioned the person at the front desk about the shuttle and to my surprise they had forgotten all about it. They offered to pay for a taxi but by the time it sowed up, the shuttle had arrived. The shuttle for our return was perfect. We called prior to getting our bags and by the time we got outside the shuttle was there. TIP: Re-confirm your shuttles!

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Tunsis
Reviews.Content: We did the stay, park and fly that is available here, staying at the end of our trip. At the start, checking in to park the car, was fast and efficient. Their shuttle dropped us off at the airport. Arriving back in Toronto, we called and within 5 minutes, the shuttle was there to pick us up. Checking in to stay was fast. Staff were very friendly and courteous. Our room was clean, nicely decorated, everything worked, and the beds were really comfortable. There is a safe in the room if one choses to use it, at no extra cost. Convenient to have Moxie's as part of the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockDad73
Reviews.Content: Normally I stay at boutique hotels because of the personal attentive service but the trade show selected this as the official hotel. Pros- Shuttle for airport Professional courteous staff Clean Stylish decor Cons- Very poor wifi internet access (SLOW, SLOW, SLOW) - for someone who is a business traveller this is critical!! If you are going to provide a coffee machine in the room please provide the coffee. I should not have to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay... a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: JannyLyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sandman Signature Toronto Airport hotel for 2 nights on business. The location is great - lots of restaurants within a 5 minute walk. The airport shuttle is very quick, I maybe waited 5 minutes and the trip to the airport was only a few minutes. Check-in was very quick. First impressions of the hotel are great. The lobby is very nicely decorated and modern. There is a small cafe that serves coffee, tea, muffins, etc. in the morning. Cost isn't too bad - less than $2 for a tea. There is also a Moxie's Grill attached to the hotel - don't even have to do outside, just walk down the hallway in the main lobby. Three elevators meant never having to wait for very long. First impression when the elevator opened was not great. The Sandman is a newer hotel, but it definitely is showing it's age. The carpet in the hallway was dirty and someone had left a glass in the hall (not anywhere near a room door), that stayed there for 2 days. The room looked pretty nice, but again, you can see wear and tear. In the bathroom this was most evident. Nothing major, but there was some plaster peeling on the bathroom ceiling. The desk chair didn't appear broken, but when I sat on it a handle part fell off. It didn't effect the use of the chair at all, so not a big deal. However, I left the part on the desk and it was still there the next day (after the room was cleaned). It was nice having the small coffee maker in the room. We also used the mini fridge, but not the microwave. Everything seemed to work well enough. Beds were VERY comfy, but I found the pillows too high. I personally like a soft flat pillow and my neck was hurting a bit the first morning because of the angle it was at all night. Again, not a big deal. The balcony was nice to have - but I didn't open the door at all, just watched the planes go over. You can hear the planes, especially at night trying to get to sleep, but I wasn't woken up by them at all, so I guess they didn't bother me as much as I was expecting. The one thing that really bothered me was that my silver bracelet became corroded when I went in the pool and/or hot tub. I let the front desk know the next morning, but they didn't really seem concerned. The pool is salt water, so I'm not exactly sure what happened. Overall the stay was really good - very clean and comfortable. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and will recommend this hotel at work.

Reviews.Title: “Was very nice at one time im sure going downhill”
Reviews.Author: shaker1973
Reviews.Content: This is my first day with Sandman signature Hotel Toronto the lobby is very nicely decorated impressive modern and sleek the rooms themselves are nicely decorated but you can see wear and tear on the furniture at the carpets are buckling very dirty the balcony walls are glass and filthy, and the sliding glass doors on the balcony where even worse. there was laundry and the kitchenette in my room and it was very very clean the bathrooms for sparkling. The sheets were crisp and clean, the duvet was stained and gross. The restuarant Moxies was fantastic. Parking was crowded and the spaces were tiny. This was probably a very nice hotel when it was new, but it fading fast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Two Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Funky_Jim29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights whilst on the road. The airport area has many hotels and I have never been inclined to stay in any of them. This time, I got an excellent rate through CAA and my normal location of the Holiday Inn Yorkdale was way too expensive. Parking is free. That is a real bonus in this part of the world. Some restaurants are within walking distance of the hotel. If you like Moxie's, it is attached to the hotel. I had two good dinners there but it is somewhat pricey. I did not notice any noise from the airport. The view from my room was nothing special but it is an airport hotel after all. The hotel is off of Dixon Road so it is less busy and somewhat secluded. I found the bathroom to be clean but the counter space was definitely limited. With a family, this could create some problems in organization. The beds were comfortable, but the LCD TV was puny (around 25 inches ?, I am guessing). The TV's must have been added when LCD screens were expensive. I tend to spend little time in the hotel other than sleeping so TV is not that important to me. If you have a car, then you have good access to major highways in the area but you will have to travel a bit to find shopping. All in all, it is an excellent airport location "off the strip" and there are good restaurants in the local area. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: lspo
Reviews.Content: The Staff was nice. They were close to the airport. They had a really nice restaurant attached to the hotel. They have a coffee shop there too. It was closed the first day...not sure why. They have a computer room to catch up on emails. I had a "family room". This meant that there were bunk beds in the first room, and then a small kitchenette (microwave and mini fridge) and then the bathroom and room with King bed. The King bed was SO comfy. I would stay again. I am not sure how expensive this is compared to other hotels in the area. I would say this is a 4 star (out of 5).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: MikeSteven
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the cleanliness of the room. It was very well designed and excellent comfort with the bed. The transportation between the airport and the hotel was complimentary and convenient. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. We would definitely stay here again when encountering a layover in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A great stop”
Reviews.Author: 2-seniors-eh
Reviews.Content: As a matter of practice we stay over at one of the Toronto Airport Hotels before leaving and upon returning from a trip. It really helps to get you into the vacation mode. This latest trip we stayed at the Sandman. The room rate was really good and included free parking for the duration of the trip. The desk staff were freindly and efficient as was the shuttle service to and from the airport. The rooms are pretty much standard but they are clean, well setup and the beds were comfortable. We also found the rooms quiet for their proximity to the airport which is important when you getting up very early in the morning to catch a flight. We had dinner at Moxies the first night which was good and we tried the breakfast counter in the lobby which was fine (coffee, juice, muffins and breakfast wraps) inexpensive and met our needs. Within easy walking distance are a number of good restaurants including Tucker's Marketplace with awesome lunch and dinner buffets and Jack Astors with great burgers.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware with this place”
Reviews.Author: TripAdv264
Reviews.Content: The first room they tried to give me had a semen stain on the desk chair. The second room had a plugged toilet. When I went back to the lobby for the second time, the hotel clerk told me there were no more rooms but that she could give me a plunger so I could unplug the (previous guest's) business. At that point I said I'd rather go to another hotel. They refused to refund my money. While I was in the lobby, another guest was complaining about poor service at the hotel. Expedia (thank goodness) stepped in and moved me to another place down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but breakfeast is not included :(”
Reviews.Author: thanhmark
Reviews.Content: It's a nice looking hotel that's conveniently located next to the airport. With that said, the pool sucks, breakfast isn't included (it's expensive to boot), and there's nothing to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent service, clean rooms, within 5 minutes of airport.”
Reviews.Author: bananidog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business trip. Rate per night was better than most in the area. Free airport shuttle. Front desk staff was efficient and friendly. Rooms were clean & well supplied. Beds were clean and comfortable. Wi-Fi available, and internet access is FREE! Always a nice perk for business travelers. Moxie's Restaurant is on site, and provided us with some great meals and munchies during our stay. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “COULD BE BETTER”
Reviews.Author: garry9
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd stay at Sandman at Toronto airport. Great expectations were dashed early on. . Booked on internet a exec king suite but was given a regular room. Quickly changed by reception. Had trouble with Wi Fi in room.Advised to to get signal in lobby. We did that but were then only able to receive but not send e mails.Business centre had only one computor. Televisions in room not functioning well. Dirty Balcony and torn towels. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. I think that the Hotel is lacking in " attention to detail" that was in place on our first visit 2 years ago. Could be better .

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but really expensive”
Reviews.Author: Gunhild H
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ok with LCD-tv and small Nice bathrooms! We had alot of small ants in the room, they even came with us in the briefcase when we left, not nice! The wi-fi was suppose to be free, but it didn't work while we were there for two days, and they didn't inform us of that when we arrived and asked about the internet! The breakfost was ok, not more not less! Don't think we will go back because of the overprice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nelix_ca
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with freindly staff. Nice room and beds. Only down side was $7: 00 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, it was perfect choice for us”
Reviews.Author: skljajic
Reviews.Content: We picked up this hotel following number of great review on Tripadvisor and good ratings in general, and we made a right choice. The hotel was just perfect - clean and large room, un-intrusive staff, nicely decorated rooms and public spaces, very pleasant. We had no time this time to try the restaurant this time but we may do that next time. It would be better if they offerred free breakfast included in price, or at least free parking (parking is CAD 7 / day). We needed a good hotel in Mississauga and we got it. We shall return here next time we are in Ontario... Internet is free and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: BellaMami
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and nice staff!!!Great hotel if you have a connecting flight the next day...5 minutes to the airport. But there's nothing around this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and especially recommended for bird owners”
Reviews.Author: Murdochsroomate
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews of this hotel, I cancelled another booking I had at an identically-priced hotel and checked in here instead. I sure was happy with this hotel. Spotless room. Modern decor. Quiet. Nice soaker tub in the bathroom. And great service. I was traveling with a sick bird who had to see a vet specialist, and the staff were terrific about him. Each day, when we ordered room service, we asked for some spinach leaves for the bird. Really, one would've sufficed, but they always brought him lots without charging us. Once, when we were out for an extended period of time, we phoned to see if the staff could check on him for us, and they did so right away. After all that, they didn't even charge us the usual pet surcharge (I guess because birds don't make much of a mess). Oh, and the food from room service (Moxie's) was great too. Best French toast ever. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel, Best in the Area!”
Reviews.Author: Habs99
Reviews.Content: Very modern, almost like a boutique hotel. Front desk staff were very polite, rooms were nice and clean. Paid for parking, but very affordable. Check in and Check out service was efficient. Complimentary shuttle to the airport, only about 10 minutes. Great Moxies restaurant in the hotel. Night staff was exceptional, had some issues with noise in the hall and they were very quick to respond. Even changed our room so we can get a quiet night's sleep as we had an early departure. Would definitely recommend to anyone going away on vacation, or a layover. Excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Too much management changes”
Reviews.Author: MrTravel007
Reviews.Content: I go here often and over the last few years this place has gone through 3-4 diferent supervisors. It's annoying for business travel as things and deals change with every new management, but won't affect you just for 1-2 night stays for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: timoomen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on the night after our wedding before we flew out for our honeymoon, this month we had our first year anniversary and stayed at the hotel again. I love the spacious rooms and the feel of the hotel. Looks modern and clean. We had an amazing dinner at the moxie's downstairs and would go again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare yourself for one of the best yet”
Reviews.Author: uk_explorer79
Reviews.Content: I don't like to rave, I'm a calm person, but this hotel is AWESOME. What a shame about the location. The Sandman is excellently appointed and you will not believe the room sizes. Compared to say London prices the hotel is astonishing value. I paid around $130/night for a "Executive" room and had a full kitchen, a small sitting room a good size double bedroom and a well appointed bathroom. The on-site restaurant (part of the local Moxies chain) is absolutely one of the best Canadian or American hotel restos I have come across and the staff are nothing but stunning in their knowledge of the menu and wine list as well as the local area and are always happy to give suggestions/ideas for things to do and see in Toronto. The gym and pool are perfectly adequate, the pool being slightly smaller than you might prefer if you are a regular swimmer. The gym has all the cardio and general machinary you could care for, including some weight lifting machines. I often noticed BA and AA air crew using the hotel as Pearson airport is close by and there is an on-demand shuttle service. This is both a blessing and a curse. The hotel lies directly to the centre of the approaches for RW24 L/R and as such is subject to frequent air traffic in the proximity. However the excellent glazing helps to keep the noise to a minimum but it is always there! There are a couple of local golf courses (sorry I don't recall the names) which where both very welcoming to pay and players.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babystyles05
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about 20 minutes from downtown Toronto and from the science center which was the main reasons for our trip. It was very modern, quiet, and convenient. The bar downstairs was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Toronto airport's most stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelM0nkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here very briefly - a flight cancellation resulted in a last minute stay. The last minute price was 160 for a king room, not too bad... We seemed to wait a lot longer for the shuttle than if we had stayed elsewhere, maybe it was our bad luck but every other hotel shuttle seemed to turn up before ours! The check-in staff were not too efficient either, and made the annoying assumption that i was to share a room with my boss, which always irritates me on business trips, particularly when we requested 2 rooms when we first phoned them to book. However, these are small things, overall I was really pleased with the hotel and thought the room and bathroom was really nice in sexy dark colours. The bed was comfortable too - i was concerned as some reviews on here say it is hard, it was fine and my room was nice and quiet. Though I did think the crowne plaza bed was more comfortable i slept really well on both. Overall, this hotel is a great choice, it is very stylish and sexy for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near Airport- horrible beds”
Reviews.Author: wonderguest
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice and clean; staff are quick to respond to problems and fix as required. The one thing I didn't really enjoy was the beds- I found them so hard (and I can sleep on a lot of beds without complaint) that I had to sleep on the couch in the room. Even the couch was hard but slightly less so than the bed. The bed's hardness was comparable to sleeping on a pile of bricks. Also- though its nice because of the airport, be forewarned that it is in the direct flight path of the really big jets which means that you can hear them quite loudly in your room especially the further up you go.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and very high end!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, free shuttle to and from the airport, elegant and really good service. The price to park your vehicle is very cheap! I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “ELEGANT ATMOSPHERE AND JUST GREAT FOR BUSINESS TRAVELLERS”
Reviews.Author: CIPVenezia Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I pleasantly found out that this hotel had everything I needed. Good price for the service that I received (i.e. free internet, free parking. free shuttle, great location near the airport and near the main free way. Starbucks in the lobby for early morning departures or simply handy just to get an espresso, very nice restaurant and room service was very efficient. All the personnel working in this hotel were very helpfull and very friendly. I simply liked it!! Rooms were very clean. The quality of the hotels near the airport are not always so great and they are expensive, so this hotel was a very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Murphyflyer
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the YYZ airport and reasonable rate. nice big rooms with great bed and quiet. Stayed there twice, on the way to the Caribbean and on the return. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: yoda10000
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, which I feel deserves more than a 3 star review. It is a little far away from downtown, however the hotel was a joy to come back to. We stayed in the family suite which was great, as there are 2 rooms. Overall , extremely happy with a hotel that made our wonderful holiday even better

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Jonnymilesaway
Reviews.Content: Only here for 1 night but this stood out from the myriad identikit bland airport hotels I have stayed at. It was actually nice! great value, nice comfortable room and a decent modern fitness suite.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay before you fly out the next day”
Reviews.Author: chops94
Reviews.Content: pro's- great location and 24 hour shuttle, park and fly is great place is new and very clean and room was nice and spacious bed was pretty comfortable resturant downstairs is convenient but milestones is overpriced, i'd rather spend my money at the airport keg down the road better value cons afternoon staff isn't the friendliest they dont go out of the way to help you, but early morning staff seemed better I would stay either here or the Crowne Plaza next trip

Reviews.Title: “Dr”
Reviews.Author: mullaboy
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels are different and this one works well. The room was clean, quiet, well maintained and well equipped. It had a fridge, coffee maker, microwave, dishes, good free wifi, a thermostat that works, comfortable bed, a separate sitting room, free convenient long term parking, and a free shuttle that shuttles only for this hotel. The desk staff were more pleasant than usual. We travel fairly often and have tried most of the Toronto Airport hotels. We like this one best.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: clafond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman Signature Hotel the night before a morning flight to our destination. Checking in was easy and quick. The room looked very modern and sophisticated. The airport shuttle bus was on. When we returned from our trip, we called the hotel and the bus came to pick us up at the airport in a timely fashion. The parking is lit and we felt that it was a secure place to leave our car while we were away. We didn't use any of the hotel amenities so I cannot comment on these. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay here again and to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay over”
Reviews.Author: JAEMH
Reviews.Content: Big room, good restaurant, shuttle service worked out well. Just everything you need for a comfortable one night stay over. We recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Sandman Signature Hotel Toronto Airport”
Reviews.Author: sharkbait98
Reviews.Content: Stopover Hotel This hotel was amazing. With the stop over rate we received 15 days free parking with the one nights stay and of course, free 24 hr airport shuttle. The hotel was very modern and comfortable. The staff was polite and professional. Our room was decorated with a modern theme and was very clean. The beds were amazing. I slept like a baby. The shuttle was on time on the way to and from the airport. The driver was very polite as well. We will definitely be staying there again. I have even recommended this hotel to my good friends. Sharkbait

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Stayed in for Quite Some Time”
Reviews.Author: canuckjetsetter
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at two of the Sandman Signature locations and must say they've won me over in both Toronto and Vancouver. The room consisted of a separate living room/ bedroom area with dual climate control. Living area consisted of a love seat, chair and two leather foot rests which could easily be used for additional seating. A wide-screen t.v. sat on the desk which itself was quite large. Small kitchenette came equipped with black counter tops, microwave, deep sink, fridge and cutlery and glasses. Bathroom had all amenities required included a "makeup" mirror, automated fan control and outgoing shower curtain to increase shower room. Bedroom area had amazing bedding and abundance of pillows as well as an additional television and phone. Sometimes it's the small things that add up and I noticed the alarm clocks had the ability to project the time on the ceiling - amazing! Coffee was VanHoute and ice machine was right outside my door. Lighting was perfect and provided various mood settings. Very contemporary design throughout the entire hotel. Only concern (which has nothing to do with the hotel) was the restaurant and room service provided by Moxies. I ordered 3 times (appetizer and drink, dinner and drink and breakfast the next morning). Good timing of delivery however presentation was very inconsistent. Never did I receive a side of condiments and/or salt/pepper and at least once I failed to receive a napkin. Also, when I order coffee from room service, I am usually greeted with a carafe of coffee - not a cup of horrible (not VanHoute) room temperature java. Especially at $3 a cup! Overall though, Sandman Signature has guaranteed my business in both YYZ and YVR for the foreseeable future. Sure the Sheraton in downtown Los Angeles exceeds the amenities found here, but at almost double the price. I would highly recommend either location to anyone traveling. Pearson location is a little further than most hotels in the area but I only waited about 10 minutes for a shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Good layover hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelincritic
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for as layover with free shuttle and free wireless. The restaurant served a good dinner and the service was great all around from the shuttle driver to check in to the restaurant. They couldn't have been nicer. I would not stay here to see Toronto but would definitely stay here for another layover. There are nothing but hotels around, no restaurants, nothing!

Reviews.Title: “SUV stolen during my 6 hour stay,nice hotel for a flight stop over”
Reviews.Author: lazytraveler705
Reviews.Content: This reveiw is from back in may 2009,i usual never review canadian hotels because i stay in way to mainy. First off id like to say that this is a nice hotel for the $ and is on the airport stripe and would be great airport sleepover if you were shuttled over or drove a normal vehicle.the location is off the stripe and i feel this hotel is made a target for car theft.i checked in at midnight and by 6am my new H2 sut was gone.i choose this hotel because it was a very nice hotel and had free parking while i was heading to vegas encluded,i never did get the chance to leave my sut for the week though.i would recommend this hotel 3 out of 5 because it is has nice accomadations but the security and staff help with my car theft didnt make use feel we recieved good service at all..

Reviews.Title: “40 feet from nowhere -”
Reviews.Author: g2ad
Reviews.Content: Now, I'll be the first one to say that I SHOULD NOT have stayed so far away from downtown, but even that said, this is FAR. There is NOTHING around this area other than 12 other large hotels. (what is with the hotel mecca out there?) OK, so enough with the mea culpas, let's get to the hotel. I have to say that the hotel was better than other "airport" hotels I've been at. The Bar (Moxies) was actually really good, and the clientele was young hip and relaxed. Nowhere to dance, but just a place to meet friends before going out for the night it seemed. I wouldn't The biggest design flaw was not enough electrical outlets, but the tub and the bed were great. A lot of nice touches. the wireless was awful, but there was a cable connection at least.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Burntnorton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable and just a short shuttle trip from the airport. The staff are friendly and helpful in dealing with requests for late check outs etc. It is a good testament to the quality of the hotel that it appeared that when we stayed the majority of the other guests were aircrew. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable and quiet considering that we could see planes flying low not far away. A big plus was the excellent Moxie's Grill downstairs that provided a great meal to help the time go by. Free internet and other facilities are provided to help make your stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karakas10
Reviews.Content: I went to Toronto Sandman Signature because a training was organized there. (Otherwise I would have never thought of selecting it.) It is a decent hotel, offering the basics that you would expect in a civilized country for this price. It is close to the airport, with free shuttle from and to the airport. It is all right for one night between flights, but I had to stay there five days, which was definitely too much for me. The staff is professional and friendly, I had no problems at check-in, check-out or any other time. The decoration is modern. It is of course a matter of taste whether you like it or not. I didnâ€™t. The design around the reception area is laughable; the brown-black-white decor of the rooms is too dark and a little depressing to me. There is absolutely nothing friendly, beautiful or comforting in the internal design anywhere in the hotel. The rooms are kept spotlessly clean. The beds are very soft, which was not a problem for me, but if you have back problems, better stay away from the place. There is a tea and coffee maker in each room, but due to the shape of the pot, the coffee often ended up beside the mug, which practically never happens to me at home. After two days I gave up, tired of making a mess. The sound insulation of the windows is excellent, nothing comes in from noise of the airplanes. This was, however, compensated by the humming of the ice machine and the Pepsi automat right in front of my door. I woke up several times believing that somebody is vacuuming the carpet on the corridor at night, but it was just the two machines. The view from the rooms vary, the lucky guests see a golf course, others may admire the ruins of an abandoned hotel, or the weeds on an empty site. There is a restaurant in the hotel, offering decent food. There you can have breakfast from six â€“ if the cook happens to arrive on time. I was unlucky in the first morning, and had to wait quite a bit. (After that I did not try, rather saved some sandwiches or cookies for breakfast each evening.) A decent breakfast costs about 20 CAD (breakfast is not included in the room price), but it is not the usual buffet breakfast meaning you have to wait for your meal. The fitness room is OK for a hotel. There is an over-sized public bathtub in the building which they call pool. The hotel has three rather large and fast elevators, so you never have to wait long. If you are into sports and prefer to take the stairs â€“ no, you definitely donâ€™t want to see those stairsâ€¦ Other than golf courses and a fitness center, there is absolutely nothing to do or see around the hotel. It is surrounded by other hotels, office buildings and a few restaurants. There is not even a convenience store within walking distance. So make sure you donâ€™t leave anything at home, because once you are at Sandman Signature, it wonâ€™t be easy to get whatever you need, be it medication, shaving foam or a pair of socks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raj80_2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman Signture hotel for a couple of nights. Would definetly stay there again. Great hotel, modern, clean and quiet, with free internet, jacuzzi, gym and a swimming pool. Location would be something to think about if you don't hire a car. We did so it wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel only one issue during my stay”
Reviews.Author: Dansladen
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel after reading the good reviews from other TA members. Check in was quick and easy. My room was clean and spacious and the room A/C worked great and free Internet!. Only issue that I had was the bed. The mattress had the usual one side worn out and the other side was hard as rock. In all, I would not hesitate to use this hotel again as long as I get a better mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Great place overall. Great rooms. Free...”
Reviews.Author: ord737fo
Reviews.Content: Great place overall. Great rooms. Free wired Internet. Live the seperate sitting room and bedroom. Seperate air units for each. But the down side is, if you don't have a car there is nothing to eat anywhere except the expensive hotel restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Beautiful PLace to Stay in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Ed&DawninSouderton
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the Sandman Signature for our trip to the Hockey Hall of Fame last month. It was an extremely beautiful hotel with impeccable service. It was very clean and quiet and the bed was SO cozy-we didn't want to get out of it! We ate at Moxies which is inside the hotel and that was incredible also. The servers we had were above and beyond nice and the food was so delicious! We especially loved the sweet potato fries! We enjoyed having a balcony where we sat and watched planes taking off and landing at the airport nearby but interestingly we could not hear them AT ALL in our room. Not even a hint of noise during our entire stay. It's a very beautiful hotel with a nice price and we highly recommend it to you! We'll be staying there again when we travel to Toronto without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Best Toronto airport hotel experience yet!”
Reviews.Author: norontcpl
Reviews.Content: I'd like to preface this by saying we have stayed at the Sheraton Gateway, the Renassiance, Crown Plaza and the Marriott at the Toronto airport. We had the best experience at this property. The room was incredible with great beds and very clean. The shuttle was convenient both ways. Front line staff was professional, quick to serve & provided great advice.

Reviews.Title: “A very very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: benPrinceGeorge
Reviews.Content: I travel over 200 days a year which means over 200 hotel/motels per year. This Sandman is very very nice. The front desk staff help & friendly. There is plenty of parking. easy access to hwys. etc. Our room was quiet considering it was next to the elevators but you would never know it. I do recommend this hotel. "well done Sandman"

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel With Only A Few Small Concerns”
Reviews.Author: gcs0220
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sandman Signature for a week at the begining of May, 2010. We had a family room for four of us (two adults, two teens); which consisted of a main bedroom and a seperate area with a bunk bed. The room had two TV's, a microwave, refrigerator, toaster, kettle, and coffee maker. Complimentary Wi-Fi or LAN is available, so we were will connected. The hotel is within a couple of minutes drive of the airport and it takes about 30 minutes to get to downtown. Our room was $89 per night + taxes. We had a few small concerns: First, the AC is a window mount system in the "parents" area, while the thermostat is located in the children's area. This means that the parents room is very cold and the kids area warmer. There is no air supply/return in the kids area and it gets stuffy if the parent's room door is closed. Second, our room safe was locked when we arrived. The hotel was not able to locate a pass key for the entire week of our stay and we could not use the safe. We had access to put our valuables in the hotel main safe as an alternative. Third, our bedding was soiled (black marks) and needed to be changed. After it was changed, the new sheets had a hole. Finally, there were four of us in the room but house keeping kept giving us only two sets of towels. We repeatedly had to request more towels, shampoo, and conditioner over the week of our stay. All these small concerns aside, the hotel is very well appointed and worth a stay. It's worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: gingermrs
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the sandman for the last 2 nights on our way back through Toronto before a flight. We tried here because we were late booking and there wasnt much else available plus I had remembered the good reviews from tripadvisor. The hotel is only a few years old and looks nicer than some of the other hotels in the area. staff were helpful and let us store our bags away before a later flight. The lobby is quite funky and impressive. Our room was nice, bathroom great and very comfy beds. AC was a little loud and we were on the side of the hotel where you heard quite some noise from the planes. my husbands parents stayed also and they looked over the golf course and heard nothing so it must depend where you are. They have stayed in many hotels by the airport and said its not much different from the crowne plaza but we didnt have much to compare it to Would recommend,and would stay again. Beds make for a great night sleep

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasSharvi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful...the front desk staff, the rooms- with small kitchens, the beds and the location near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for excellent price”
Reviews.Author: DavePamOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before we left on vacation. This hotel was lovely, the rooms were clean and trendy, the beds were very comfortable, and the restaurant was great. We will be staying here everytime we fly out of pearson, for the price and the free parking when you are away, it's the perfect start of any vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: enzo4me
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for business instead of the crowne plaza down the road. Great style and service. Here where my two issues: 0.79 cents for two toll free calls. $7.00 parking.. I would definitely stay at this hotel again specially because of the moxies on the bottom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Super helpful and friendly hotel staff/manager, clean, comfortable,quiet”
Reviews.Author: FionaWaterloo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I lived at Days Hotel for 2 nights on Jan 25 and Jan 27. We are very impressed by the super helpful, friendly hotel manager and staff as well as the clean, comfortable, quiet and convenient hotel room. The price is very reasonable compared with other hotels around Yorkdale mall area. Itâ€™s definite a good buy! We are currently booking this hotel again for this weekend trip. Super helpful and friendly hotel staff and managers: My husband and I booked on line for 2 days trip: Jan 25 and 26. While after we checked in on Jan 25, we were informed that our appointment at downtown was rescheduled. My husband went down the lobby and explained our situation to the front desk and asked whether we could reschedule our hotel date due to our appointment date change. Frankly speaking, I thought the rescheduling was impossibleâ€¦ To my surprise, the front desk guy listened to our explanation very patiently and explained this change requires the managerâ€™s approval and he would call the manager. Since it was 9:00pm, the manager already finished his day shift and returned home. The front desk immediately called the managerâ€™s cell phone and left a message. Surprisingly about 10 minutes later, the front desk called our room and told us the manager called back and approved our reschedule suggestion. We are really amazed by how friendly and helpful the front desk and manager are at Days Inn hotel. They are really thinking from the customerâ€™s position! Clean, comfortable, super quiet and convenient hotel at very reasonable price: Compared with the other hotels close to Pearson airport, the price is very favourable. The bathroom and bedroom and living areas are very clean and tidy. The king bed is super comfortable. Even though itâ€™s close to the highways, you can not hear any noise inside the room. Additionally, we found a microwave and an empty fridge inside our suite, which we can put in our own food! This is super convenient that weâ€™ve never find in any other 4 or 5 star hotels that weâ€™ve lived in Toronto before (there may be a fridge, but was always filled with expensive hotel drinks). Glad we choose Days In Hotel and looking forward to our next trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need!”
Reviews.Author: 7_seas_traveler
Reviews.Content: I did not know nothing about the Sandmann group until I booked a room via www.ebookers.de. i am usually very carefull and check out the hotels at least online before I book. Having checked the hotel and compared against others near the Airport, i decided to book. it was just for one night and I came from Sydney. So i had a long flight already behind me with Canada Airlines, where i already got fed up with the service overall. Can you believe that the Executive Lounge at Vancouver airport doesn't even have showers?! However. I booked a Double room for myself and it was considerably cheap against other hotels in the area (Hilton, Sheraton and Holiday Inn). So I did not expect much at all. A bed to sleep in and a functioning TV would have been ok already. I came with a Taxi not knowing that there would be also a free of charge pick up from the airport. It was only 12 CAD anyway. I had two heavy bags to unload. Gracefully the taxi driver halped me since nobody was in front. But yet again, i did not expect it at all. At the friont desk. i got spotted already by a gentleman but he didn't bother to acknowledge me. The lady next to him clarified something with a guest in front of me and asked me to come over after that. She was VERY POLITE and skilled. With her warm welcome (without any welcome drink or other nonsense) with a sincere smile, I even forgot the male agent. She booked me into a room on the 16th floor, which appeared to be the Penthouse floor. I remind you that i booked online and only a normal room as far as i remember, not a suite or so. I ended up in a family room with 1 stock bed in the front room and a nice roomy master bedroom. The view from that room was great even though just overlooking Missisauga Area. it became special to me because a thunderstorm went over the area and the lightnings were amazing. The bed was a big Queensize. The one and only negative point about the room was that the sheets were wrinkled. It looked like somebody else was laying in the bed before but I couldn't make out further details to proof that and so I didn't bother. I slept fantastic. In the morning i had to get used to the shower curtain. You know, if that thing gets stuck at your bump, you almost wanna jump out of the shower but I managed. Breakfast at the attached franchised restaurant and Bar MOXI's was also above average but with small hick up's. The service was casual as expected. There was no Hostess to be find, so i set myself. A young girl in leggings came through to me and handed me a breakfast menu. A little later a waiter with black fingernails and colored eye lashes served me. I found that OK. He was skilled, experienced and polite. The girl in the leggings came back to the neighbour table to dust it as well as the wood on top of the benches and the wall panels. She probably thought, if she does my bench seat as well now, she doesn't have to do it later and went on while I was eating my breakfast. That wasn't very nice. I got a call in the morning that I will be picked up in the evening. So I went to the Front Desk and asked, if it is possible to keep the room until about 6 pm on a dayroom rate. Unfortunately the hotel did not offer dayroom rates. But the lady (not the one from my check in) offered me the same room, I stayed in for 50% and that was just fair. She was also very polite and skilled. The Sandmann's Signature Hotel is one of the less hotels, I would want to stay in longer than just one night. I had an overall fantastic stay and now I know where to sleep when I will be back in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort, service, price.”
Reviews.Author: jbwtally
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Sandman during business trips for more than a year, 10-15 nights per month. The rooms are very roomy and comfortable, the service is excellent, and the staff are very professional and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Five star accomodations for a 2 star price”
Reviews.Author: sirius5600
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Sandman Signature Toronto Airport hotel since last October in between frequent business trips to Europe. The accommodations are impeccable. The staff are friendly, courteous, and professional. Everyone goes out of their way to make guests feel at home. The overall cleanliness, service and quality of this hotel makes it compare very favorably with many of the 5 star hotels I have stayed in. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “awesome place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: cheeky197574
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with three friends and we stayed there for one night before heading to Jamaica...We were very impressed with the hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat!! Everyone was very helpful and friendly and Moxie's was very impressive. We had breakfast there the next morning and thought it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: gardengirl102
Reviews.Content: We booked this hitel since we got a special rate because we booked our trip through Selloffvacations.com. We were very pleased with this hotel. the room was quiet and well-appointed. It was not really large (we just had a standard room) but it met our needs. We enjoyed dinner at Moxies and it was nice to just go upstairs to our room - no need to drive. The beds were super comfy. We took the shuttle in the morning and they provided a taxi for us on our return (since we arrived home very late at night). The front desk staff were helpful. We will be booking here whenever we need an Toronto airport stopover and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Druxys
Reviews.Content: Our room was in a noisy location. We would have switched but we have very young children and it was too much of a pain to go back to the front desk and ask for an alternate room - we arrived late. We were close to the elevators and we were repeatedly disturbed by loud guests returning to their rooms. We had a family suite - childrens bunk beds are unusually high. The top bunk is so close to the ceiling - my 5 year old did not like it. She had a very difficult time sleeping. The temperature controls are an issue - it's a new hotel with an outdated system - cannot control temperature in the children's bedroom. The bathroom is very small. The service in Moxie's was slow and inattentive. We were disappointed for the $199 rate we paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Elegent, Chic, Romantic, Warm, Clean - Great Choice and not pricey!”
Reviews.Author: faycandice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our wedding night and a second night as well in a suite. Gorgeous room with a jacuzzi tub and separate living area and kitchen. Clean, well kept. Elegant, chic lobby area. And was not a ridiculous price at all! Very very good buy. definitely a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFBM
Reviews.Content: I was flying out of Pearson International airport in the morning and was looking for a place to stay close to the airport. The Sandman hotel was extremely close and offered great value. It was only $20 to $30 more than other hotel in the area like the Holiday Inn etc. but offer far superior rooms. All rooms are suites with a living area and separate bedroom. Also Moxies restaurant is in the hotel and their room service is catered through them. So me and my girlfriend choose to order room service to our room and enjoy food and wine and relax in the living area. Would stay there again when traveling â€“ looking forward to going back. Great find!

Reviews.Title: “warm and calm”
Reviews.Author: hakodx
Reviews.Content: I stayed this March. It was still cold but the employees were very kind, walm, and calm. I was glad to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Uniformly Abysmal Customer Service - Not Worth Missing Your Flight”
Reviews.Author: IAmNotANewfie
Reviews.Content: Multiple problems with booking confirmation from hotel. Staff polite but unwilling to solve problems related to their errors. Icing on the cake was not following through on the wake-up call. All we needed was a place to sleep 12 hours before a flight. They mishandled every aspect of the interaction. And are unrepentant.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrTravel007
Reviews.Content: I have really nothing bad to say except if you go with a family they only have 2 towels in the family room???? And the main bedroom you can't shut the door because the themostat is by the bunk beds lol. If you are staying by yourself for business it's awesome with a Moxies underneath :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my husband, parents and 3 yr old daughter. On arrival, we were greeted by a smiling porter, who offered my daughter some fruit from the bowl at reception. The rooms were spotlessly clean and decorated to a high standard. My parents felt it was a bit too posh for them, but it wasn't expensive. Although we were close to the airport, I was not aware of much noise overnight. There was no sound from the rooms next to us either. The only down side is that breakfast isn't included (we've found that buffet breakfasts at motels/hotels are becoming commonplace nowadays, but rare 10-15 years ago). There is a restaurant on site but there was a menu in the room and we could see that the prices were really high. However, there are a few restaurants nearby and we located a Tim Hortons and Subway within a few minutes drive. It's not close to downtown, so we drove in to town the next day and parked at an all-day parking lot for about $10. This was a lot cheaper than staying at a decent downtown hotel. Most downtown hotels charge for parking too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! Amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: cnft
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay after reading the reviews here. I am so pleased we did! We got a Family Suite for under $100 USD per night on a weekend. The suite had 2 rooms. The first was a child's room near the door with bunk beds, a TV and bean bag chairs. The bean bag chairs were such a cute, useful touch and our kids loved them. The second room had a very nice, comfortable king-sized bed, flat screen TV, desk and large window. Our original plan was to put both kids in the child's room, but my daughter is only 3 years old and felt too scared to sleep in her own room with her baby brother in a foreign place. So the first night, I slept with my daughter in the child's room. I did not sleep well at all. There was a lot of noise from the hallway and the bed was pretty hard. However, she slept very soundly. The second night, I traded with my husband, and slept in the adult room with my baby. My husband had no problems sleeping in the child's room. He didn't notice the noise from the hallway and felt the bed was nice and firm. My daughter had another good night's sleep in the child's room as well. I am a light sleeper, but both of them are heavy sleepers so it was great for them. The king bed was very comfortable with amazing pillows and a cozy comforter. The kitchenette was great. The toiletries provided in the bathroom were quality products that smelled terrific! The hotel lobby is modern and very nice. The hotel rooms are very nicely decorated. The service I received at this hotel is the best hotel service I have ever had! The front desk staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. Very easy check-in and check-out. We had a problem with a lock in our room that was resolved immediately and courteously. The hotel pool is small, but clean. The electronic room key cards had to be fixed a couple of times throughout our stay as they stopped working. We also had an issue with the temperature in the suite. Most guests staying in a Family Suite want to close the door between rooms - thus, the reason for getting the suite instead of just a hotel room with 2 beds. We were told by the staff at check-out that the closing of this door messes up the thermostat. The heater is set up so that you cannot adjust it manually, you can only adjust the temperature which is not accurate. We were either way too hot or way too cold any time the door was closed. This needs to be fixed by management asap. Also, they provide a hair dryer that cannot be plugged in to the outlet in the bathroom due to the size of the hair dryer plug and the proximity of a screwed down bathroom mirror on the wall. I just took the hair dryer into the bigger bedroom and used the mirror there. Seemed like a strange thing in a hotel so full of great decor and amazing service. We wanted to eat in the restaurant located within the hotel, but walked over to it and determined it was a little too nice for young children. Would recommend to anyone as long as they are heavy sleepers or do not sleep in the child's room of the Family Suite. The hotel location is somewhat removed from the energy and life of the city, but we were more than willing to make that sacrifice for such a great stay. The area on the other side of the highway seemed a little dirty and sketchy, but the immediate area of this hotel seemed quite safe. We consider this place to be quite a find and will stay here anytime we are in the Toronto area.

Reviews.Title: “I am staying here again in October 2009”
Reviews.Author: davek9647
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, relaxing. Also good grub available on site.

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel with superb quality”
Reviews.Author: FLIEGER67
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the afternoon with Air Transat from Frankfurt and joined the bunch of people waiting for the hotel shuttles. The hotels website stated a free bus transfer. Several hotel chaines coming and going, not the Sandman. After 30 minutes IÂ´ve tried to call, well, as usual in such situations the number has changed!. And when IÂ´ve secured the new number, the shuttle runs around the corner. Some ten minutes to the hotel. No time to wait at check in, the real friendly girl there told me that the shuttle runs not with a fixed schedule, it runs by call. Ok so far. Immediatelly after IÂ´ve asked for a top floor room the girl offered me storey 15 with a nice view to the approaching planes into Toronto airport. Gladly accepted. And much to my surprise she offered me also a free breakfast voucher for my two times at the hotel. The room was spacious and perfectly clean. A large bed and also a working area and separate sofa and chairs. The bathroom fitted with the warm welcomed bathtub. No remarkable noise from the planes or from the rooms nearby. No buffet style breakfast here, the girl cant believe that I only asked for some toast and jam together with coffee in the morning, no full canadian style breakfast needed. Good quality, friendly staff over all, the shuttle runs immediatelly after my calls, not more than five minutes to wait during several times IÂ´ve used it. Real good value for money here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Sandman!”
Reviews.Author: OrganicMama
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Toronto very late (near midnight) and had effortless check-in. We had reserved a family suite, and this worked out for us very well. Our two older sons (aged 12 and 6) loved the bunk beds and bean bags. The staff were very friendly. We appreciated having the microwave and refrigerator so we could have breakfast and lunch in our room. The hotel was nicely designed and outfitted. The only two things I can think of that would have improved our stay would be free parking and breakfast. (The other two hotels we stayed at in Ontario had breakfast included, but we had to pay for parking everywhere.)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: endOfPath
Reviews.Content: This year my family took a vacation to Maui. We found airfare was significantly cheaper from the Toronto airport than Rochester, NY (even including gas, parking, and hotel costs). Based on positive feedback from tripadvisor we stayed at the Sandman the night before our early morning departure. Check-in was a breeze and the man at the desk was incredibly friendly, and very helpful. I asked about room rates for the night we'd be coming home. The man offered us a discount. In the end we decided to drive home the same day because we weren't tired enough to warrant staying another night in Toronto. However, at the price offered it was rather tempting! Part of the deal there is that you can park your car for about 2 weeks. They have a shuttle service that takes you to and from the airport. The first shuttle leaves at 4:05 AM which was ideal for our 6:45 AM departure. When you return you have to call the hotel for the shuttle to pick you up. The only problem we had was that we waited 25 minutes for the shuttle when we came home. I had to make a second call. Apparently the driver went to the wrong terminal. The hotel is incredibly clean and surprisingly quiet considering the proximity to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: Rui1981
Reviews.Content: This place is new, paid 109cnd. feels like a small condo apt. i had a corner room overlooking the airport. Good restaurant, you dont have to leave the property. Hands down the best for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: Ice_Kold
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quiet even though it was beside the airport where planes land every couple of minutes. We were only in the hotel from about 8:00 pm until 10:00 am for the two nights that we stayed here. We had two big beds in each room, a bathroom, flatscreen tv, wired internet connection in the rooms and wireless internet in the lobby. Overall it's a good place to sleep and stay. There's a pool where you can go swimming as well as a Moxie's restaurant and many restaurants close in the area. The highway is also very close by which means quick access to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very large room, more than we needy but a good value.”
Reviews.Author: turtle722
Reviews.Content: Our frequent flier tickets to Spain required a 1 night stopover in Toronto. I selected the Sandman from reviews on TripAdvisor and was very pleased. The room was a suite with a full kitchen, much more than we needed for a single night. I really enjoyed the room. The only negative comment was the shuttle from the Airport. It ran very late which was nice, but we called to get it and a van with Holiday Inn markings showed up. Not a big concern, but it was the end of the drivers shift and he wanted to hand off the radio. We waited a good 10-15 minutes for another shuttle to show up and hand off the radio. Not a bid deal but at 1am and being tired was very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “2 very comfortable,affordable nights at Sandman Signature”
Reviews.Author: Mangonboat
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate through Expedia, booked itthe same day from a wif-fi coffee shop in Stratford on our way to Toronto. The hotel is easy to get in and out of via the highways, is very clean, modern and quiet, the rooms and beds were very comfortable and the front desk staff was very helpful with directions. A bit out of the way if you intend to do everything downtown, but we also went to Canada's Wonderland, and it was very convenient for that. There is a GoTrain station just up the road at the north end of the airport, so you can park there, leave your car and take the train downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overnight choice en route to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: globalwanderer2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the night of our wedding since we were leaving for our honeymoon to Greece the next day. The Sandman Signature couldn't have been more helpful, allowing us to drop off and store our bags a full week before our departure date. Despite checking in very late after our wedding, the front desk staff settled us in to our room very quickly. That said, here's our summary: ROOM - clean and very comfortable, satisfying and exceeding our expectations VALUE - In comparison to alot of the overpriced hotels in the area, you can't beat the Sandman's value for what you get in return CONVENIENCE - Literally a 7 minute cab ride from the airport terminal, perfect for anyone having to catch an early flight. STAFF - Despite our brief stay, we did have interaction with the hotel's staff, who were courteous, helpful and friendly, from assisting us in storing our luggage, to calling a taxi for us the next day to head to the airport. EXTRAS - Although we opted for for taxi, the hotel does offer a free shuttle service to the airport which is an added bonus THE BOTTOM LINE - Value-wise, the Sandma Signature is an excellent choice, and were very happy with our experience staying there for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Minor problems with room distract from overall positive experience”
Reviews.Author: silee
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Sandman Signature for a gaming conference at the International Centre. Though not ideally located for this purpose, it was simple enough to catch a cab by asking the friendly staff, though one of the cab drivers was a bit sketchy. Our plan was to stay somewhere slightly more inconvenient but a bit on the nicer side. The airport shuttle service picked me up without too much trouble and it was nice to avoid having to pay another cab. On my arrival in the afternoon, I went over to Moxie's for lunch and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food since there are plenty of Moxie's restaurants in Calgary too. The service was a bit on the slower side. I ended up eating at Moxie's three times over the weekend and the dinner services were also slow which was disappointing for a half-filled restaurant on a Friday and Saturday night. The my steak on Saturday was unevenly cooked though my rack of lamb on Friday was fine. Don't order the calamari. The hotel is clean and modern with a contemporary design. The rooms can be described the same way though the problems are below the surface. There were issues with the electronic keys not working properly to the point where we were locked out and had to get replacements. The air conditioning in our room was not cold at all and we went from 24 degrees to 26 degrees despite setting the thermostat for under 20. The closet door hiding the safe (across from a hole in the wall) was broken and wouldn't slide properly. The faucet in the washroom often sputtered with inconsistent water pressure and the shower temperature had to be adjusted often as the hot water could not be maintained. With all that said, the beds were made properly and our towels were taken care of with no complaints. My traveling companion appreciated the complimentary bottle of water. Overall, I felt like we got what we paid for (a good value) though I feel our experience could have been that much better had we not experienced these hotel room issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good start to holiday”
Reviews.Author: StevieBis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the start of our trip to Canada. Unfortunately our flight was delayed 3 hours so we didn't spend as much time here as we would have liked. Our room was very comfortable & clean and although we didn't eat at the hotel we had a drink there & found the bar and dining area quite impressive. All in all a good choice and great start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: valerie_c_vfh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and really enjoyed our stay. We liked our room, comfortable bed, nice seating area and contemporary dÃ©cor. Location was great we enjoyed seeing the planes go by and restaurants were close by. Service was great, good housekeeping and clean room. The only thing missing, for me, was a seating area outside. Would definitively stay again.

Reviews.Title: “simply the BEST airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregnlynn
Reviews.Content: our trip started out well...as our TA booked us into the Sandman for our Park n fly hotel, I telephoned them to add a friend from the area to our hotel room for the night and the airport shuttle. She is in a wheelchair so we had to make sure that they booked the wheelchair accessible van. Our TA told me that there would be an extra cost for it as our room was double occ.. I called sandman and they added my friend NO issue...and did not charge. The service was beyond exceptional from the moment we arrived in the Parking lot and beginning to unload our luggage from the car. The bellman was out in a shot to help us. He was funny and genuinely nice. He took us to the front desk , where I marvelled in the fact that I had actually only paid 89 plus tax for this place. Spotless and modern to say the least. Moxies Restaurant just off the lobby. He took us to our room..wow. not huge but BEAUTIFUL. two queen beds, flat screen tv, wireless internet...great modern washroom with deep bath.. We went over to Arizonas to meet a friend for drinks and apps...great time as always..and have to say was pleased that we did not book our usual park and fly which is right beside Arizona's...while it has always been ok for the purpose, gotta say I was still having a hard time believing how great the Sandman was After dinner we went back to the Sandman to meet our friend...and have some wine.. I had a car seat that I was taking to Punta Cana for my niece. The WONDERFUL staff at the Sandman wrapped it for me to transport. He delivered it up to our room an hour later..all ready for the plane. WONDERFUL SERVICE>>WONDERFUL ROOMS>>WONDERFUL PRICES!! What more can you ask for?? I can tell you this for sure. We travel (usually my husband and I) to Punta Cana 4 times yearly..and have found our NEW stopover hotel. Bye Carlingview..HELLO Sandman Signature. Lynn Dray Ontario

Reviews.Title: “no scenery, but quite affordable!”
Reviews.Author: ImYourMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't too far from the airport and features nice, clean rooms and a courteous staff. There is plenty of free parking in their spacious lot. These rooms appear more modern in design. I stayed in the family-sized room. This includes two bedrooms: a room with a bunkbed and a room with a king sized bed. Their was also a mini fridge and a microwave, as well. Overall, this was a nice, quiet experience for me. Not a very quick drive to the downtown area, though!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience. Some considerations when booking a family suite.”
Reviews.Author: mkia
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Sandman Signature Hotel Toronto Airport based on the positive reviews on trip advisor. The hotel was new, clean and the staff was very friendly and professional. We managed to book a family suite at a very reasonable rate and we were happy that our kids would be sleeping in a separate room with bunk beds. The good: modern, spacious, kitchenette with separate sink. Moxie's was an added bonus! Some considerations, however, when booking the family suite: family suites are all located close to the elevators. The kids room is facing the corridor and the elevator plings are definitely audible. The bunk bed is not suited for younger children under 7 (top bed is too high and it is possible to fall out). The biggest problem we experienced was that there were no air vents in the kids room. In order to keep the kids room at a resonable temperature, the air conditioner in our room had to be cranked up all the way with the door in between the rooms having to remain open. Finally, we were also fortunate enough to have the Miss Canada/Universe pageant take place in the hotel that week which made for interesting elevator rides ;)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise after long flight”
Reviews.Author: gulliver63
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night after a long haul flight. But it was a pleasant surprise. Free shuttle from the airport - which is not far. Check in was efficient and welcoming. The rooms were large, with separate sitting area - all very clean and well thought out. There is a restaurant/grill in the hotel, so we didnt have to go far to find a nice meal. Breakfast was great, but it would have been nice if it had been included in the room price. I would definitely stay here again if I needed to be close to Toronto airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but Residence Inn nearby is better”
Reviews.Author: 1Jetgirl
