Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several of the YYZ airport hotel properties over the years, and this is a good property. I prefer the Residence Inn by Marriott nearby though, if the price is similar. The Sandman's mattresses are not the best (I've had one with a noticeable dip in it and another that messed up my back) and the suites are smaller than the Residence Inn, and the Residence Inn has some complimentary food offerings that the Sandman doesn't have. I also accrue hotel points with Marriott, which helps at vacation time!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay when visiting Toronto!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aya-Aza
Reviews.Content: If anyone is planning to stay at an airport hotel, i highly recommend the Sandman. The rooms are absolutly gorgeous and the staff will treat you like royalty! They are very clean, modern and eager to please. I will definitly return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not in Tune to Families”
Reviews.Author: PHM8T6
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five and chose this hotel based on the great reviews in Trip Advisor and its apparent ability to accomodate 2 Adults and 3 Children in a Family Suite. The internet booking allows a request for 2 Adults and 3 Children with the option of the more spacious Family Suite. I requested a cot on the reservation. When we checked in we were told the suite had a King, bunk beds and could accomodate a crib. The hotel does not own cots. When pressed, a manager said he would obtain a cot from another hotel. We used the pool in the evening but could not find change rooms in the pool area. There were no bath robes supplied in the suite so there was a predicament about changing to swim. We received one key card for 5 people. I rated the hotel a "4" because it is modern, with an edgey decor. It would succeed as a downtown hotel. It is definitely not your typical airport hotel. The style of the hotel made up for the few frustrations we had. If the hotel offers a "Family Suite" and the internet booking accepts 2 Adults and 3 Children they need to alter their mindset.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air at the Toronto Airport's hotel strip.”
Reviews.Author: AnitAinTravel
Reviews.Content: I'm in the travel industry, so my veiws are sometimes more critical, however I could not find a single fault with this property. The front desk employees have welcomed me warmly and even asked for a room prefference. The lobby looks very inviting and very cosy with the fireplace. I liked my room very much: the bed was very comfortable with great linnens, the room design was sleek and the bathroom was great with a heated make up mirror. I did get a tour of the property (thanks Fabio, sorry that you will be leaving Canada soon) and everything looked excellent. The pool and hot tub were sparkling clean and the gym had pplenty of equipment to chose from. I would add a couple of chairs/loungers by the pool, because there weren't any. I went to the hotel's restaurant (Moxie's) for dinner, the menu matched in sophistication the hotel and the dishes that I have ordered were all great looking and very tasty. I'm considering staying at this property for my birthday, in August. I was getting sick and tired of the many run down hotels near Toronto Airport, as we always have to look for stop over hotels for our clients and I always like to put them in a nice place, even if it's only for 1 night before their trip, because I strongly believe that if a client's first night is an aggravation, then it may put a shadow on the whole trip. Well done Sandman! I'm looking forward to recommend you to my clients! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: remmer
Reviews.Content: The Sandman is a great addition to the Toronto Airport Hotel district. The hotel allows you to park and fly for up to 14 days. If you book through selloffvacations.com you can get really great rates on the park and fly.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to start and end a trip”
Reviews.Author: JPC1628
Reviews.Content: The Sandman is one of the many hotels that cater to the Pearson Airport travellers and are located some distance from the airport. What distinguishes the Sandman is the fact that it has a decent restaurant, and an absolutely reliable and prompt shuttle, so that the distance is actually not a factor. Noise form the airport is inaudible, unless you use the balcony (why? well... if you enjoy vistas of parking lots and/or watching planes land on two runways). The rooms are somewhat smaller than what premium chains offer, but for CAN$139 you will have a fridge (where we store/freeze food overnight when we go on trips to the Caribbean) in a very well-appointed and comfortable room. You can also ask the hotel to keep a piece of luggage while you are away (the one in which you store your Canadian winter gear). Moxy's, the restaurant, dark and bathed in music (a little loud), actually offers carefully prepared, original dishes that are well worth exploring (spinach halibut being one) for a reasonable price, a rarity in the food desert around the airport, where a lot of hotels have abandoned the idea of having a restaurant (and if you get there late, well, too bad). Just like the hotel itself, it is good value for thoughtfully designed products and services.

Reviews.Title: “Very well executed”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the latest addition to the Dixon Rd. strip so as you would expect it is fresh, modern and clean. Their trademark is green apples, which are used as a decoration in the lobby and on each floor as you exit the elevators. The on-site Moxie's restaurant is very convenient. We stayed in a family suite, and the bunk beds and bright red bean-bag chair left an impression on my eldest son. Price and service were reasonable. Only down side was that their pool was still under construction, which left Daddy with a lot of explaining to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport stayover”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to catch an early morning flight. Price was reasonable. Half hour shuttle service; about a 10 minute drive each way, not too bad at all. Didn't partake in bar / restaurant / gym activities. Hotel is obviously fairly new. Staff were extremely nice and attentive and I would not hesitate to stay here again. Room was large and well accommodated, internet was included. Felt like a "business" rather than a pleasure room, but that was OK. NO problems whatsover during short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: simpme
Reviews.Content: This property is well located and very well appointed. I was impressed by the King room. It had a sitting area, galley kitchenette and a separate sleeping area. Two flat screen TVs. All the usual and expected ammenities. As an integral part of the hotel, there is a Moxies Classic Grill. Food was good, plenty of large screen TVs in the bar and pricing was not too bad. Meeting rooms are OK. Based on the quality and price, I'd try other Sandman properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Sandman Toronto is GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: blue_25
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for my sister's wedding. We had a 2-queen bed unit and she had a deluxe king bed unit with a kitchen, washer/dryer and living room area. The rooms were very nice. The decor is so fantastic that we took some of the wedding pictures there!!! The staff is professional, friendly and helpful. They are always smiling!! I would totally recommend their wedding/event planner Adrienne....she has excellent taste. Best of all.......green apples everywhere....just for decoration or for a snack...gotta love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy & Modern - Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: glbtrottergal
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel directly and they gave me the "Manager's Rate" which was $10 cheaper than anything I found online. Hotel is new, clean and wonderfully modern! Dark woods, sleek and looks exactly like the pictures. I wouldn't say that everything is made of the best quality but it looks great. The standard rooms only come in 2 Queen beds which really crowd the room and make it tiny. My fiance did not like the bed - neither of us really slept too comfortably. It was a little lumpy, and the sheets weren't the highest quality. However not entirely unexpected - the price is a real bargain for the atmosphere you get! Another thing - we had an elevator scare, it kind of reset and made a big jolt and stopped moving for about a minute, which was a little terrifying, but as far as I know they were fixing it that night. Probably a one-off experience. The previous comment was absolutely right on the money about the service - top notch. Didn't try out the Moxie's, but it is one of my favourite restaurant chains in Toronto and I don't doubt that the food is wonderful! Overall a great experience, a romantic weekend with the fiance. As I mentioned, the price is a great bargain for a new and impressive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Microwave, Refrigerator, Lighted Make-up Mirror, Oh My!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl7555
Reviews.Content: They had me at lighted makeup mirror!!! What a cute little (big) hotel! I love the modern atmosphere...not like the usual old fashion, old smelling hotels. The room was very clean and had everything I needed. Yes, it doesn't have wireless (only wired) but ok, I'll overlook that. The staff is fabulous! They actually look and act like they really like their jobs!! How refreshing! 8-) The only downside is that they do have a little food store but the prices are outrageous! Come on, $2.50 for a microwave Kraft Mac-n-Cheese container?? I can get that at a grocery store for a buck! There are restaurants around but no shopping (within walking distance).

Reviews.Title: “Too many positives”
Reviews.Author: Catty96
Reviews.Content: There are too many good things about this hotel. The staff are too friendly and too helpful - including the staff at the Moxie's onsite. The food at the restaurant was too good. The rooms were too clean and ready on time. The mint shampoo was too refreshing. The hotel is too beautiful and too convenient to the airport by a regular shuttle (the driver made the extra effort to make sure everyone got on the bus to the airport on time!). The parking inlcuded with the hotel room seemed too good to be true. If you don't like to go to a great hotel with convenience, cleanliness, friendly staff, plus a good restaurant onsite with great service, then this won't be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ckwald
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at an airport hotel for strictly utilitarian reasons.... we're at the end of a trip, have an early start the next day and don't want to cope with much driving or unexpected traffic. Generally we expect a basic, clean, quiet hotel with a decent restaurant. Imagine our surprise when we walked into the Sandman, saw a strikingly attractive, large lobby, were greeted warmly by a young woman at the desk, dispatched rapidly to our room on the 5th floor, opened the door & found it very handsome indeed, quite spacious, in fact, with two large queen beds, a sitting area (this was a standard room) and great bathroom that included a huge make-up mirror, bless their hearts-- and lacked only a shower cap to score "perfect plus" on our rating chart. In addition, the restaurant was pretty jazzy, the service rapid, and they actually served quite good food. We were astonished. And delighted. Top marks to these folks.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: baybeeblues
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful gem. I am in the hotel industry and I think they do a wonderful job at this hotel! The staff were terrific! Front desk were all very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. The rooms are lovely, clean and well appointed. Much of the decor reminds me of a W hotel rich brown tones. Lots of very nice small touches like the apples, the honor bar in the lobby, a coffee shop in the lobby and a really terrific restaurant for dinner - the food was great for dinner. The service staff in the restaurant were equally friendly and do a terrific job! Business center was free and internet was as well. I would absolutely stay here again, I look forward to the next time I have the opportunity to stay at another Sandman Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay near the Toronto airport in several years. I was pleasantly surprised!! LOCATION- About as close to the airport as you could be. The shuttle was waiting for us when we walked out (we called before we went through customs). LOBBY- Striking is probably the best word. Very, very modern with sort of a "W-ish" feel. It's extremely modern, almost with a hard edge. You are definitely impressed and curious about what the rest of the hotel looks like. SERVICE- It was hit or miss. No one was rude, unhelpful, or unpleasant. However, some were friendlier than others. I was kind of getting the vibe that they probably aren't the happiest employees in the world. Just a feeling I got. ROOMS- Very nice. Luckily not as modern as the lobby. Very warm, inviting and cozy. The bedding was lovely and there was a very nice sitting area with a couch and 2 chairs. The bathroom was fabulous! Great tub/shower with cool toiletry items. Almost felt luxurious. THE NEGATIVE- If it wasn't for a few small things I would have probably given them an excellent. One was the inconsistent staff. The 2nd was scuff marks. Yes, scuff marks. In the hallways and in the guest rooms there were myriad scuff marks where luggage, etc has hit the walls. The fact they aren't clean/fixed shows a real lack of cleaning detail. In addition, there were a couple of spots on the carpet where it was fraying. This is a gorgeous hotel with great rooms. However, it will be a run-down 3rd tier property in a few years if the maintenance and cleaning isn't kept up!! I would definitely stay here again...at least for now!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: bambi42
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me for my birthday with a trip to the Sandman Hotel by the airport. It was AMAZING. When we arrived at the Sandman, the desk clerk (I believe his name was Munir) suggested that we upgrade to a nicer room w. a Jacuzzi and separate living area for only an extra 30 bucks (we had booked on hotels.com, and got a really great rate for the room we originally booked, so an extra 30 dollars was nothing). Once the man said Jacuzzi I was sold. Lol. Upon entering our room I believe I actually squealed with delight! It was gorgeous! Very spacious, very clean, modern, and classy. The room we were upgraded to had a full kitchen -- big fridge, stove, microwave, pots and pans, cooking utensils, coffee maker, kettle, and toaster! It also had a living room w. a flat screen TV and a huge window with a view of the golf course. The bathroom was beautiful, by far the cleanest hotel bathroom I have ever seen and most modern looking...it even had a full laundry machine and dryer! Now...the best part, by far HAD to be the bedroom. The afore mentioned Jacuzzi? Is actually situated IN the bedroom. It was WICKED. The bed itself was also lovely and very comfortable. Another cool feature was that the floor was covered in a carpet that is meant to look like hardwood floor...hard to explain, you have to see this for yourself. You can even order food to your room from the Moxie's restaurant situated in the Hotel (we got breakfast...note--don't get the French toast...it was entirely drenched in a VERY sweet strawberry syrup). Overall, we ADORED this hotel and will definitely be returning! It was a lovely way to celebrate my birthday, but I would also highly recommend it to those in need of somewhere to stay when having to stop over in Toronto as it is located very close to the airport. Also, it seemed that the shuttle service there was excellent as we say several coming and going during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Bliss - Rehearsal Heaven”
Reviews.Author: DaddyTraveller
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I are planning to stay at the Sandman for the first night of our honeymoon. We are also hosting our rehearsal dinner at Moxie's Restaurant at the hotel the day before. Front desk, restaurant management and serving staff were absolutely awesome helping us plan the dinner. The server offered us each a cup of coffee while the two of us made plans. When it came time to settle our bill, the server refused to accept any payment whatsoever. Several weeks earlier a staff person at the front desk escorted us to see the room we had reserved earlier by phone. We are just so impressed with how well we were treated each time we were at or had any dealings with the hotel. Kudos to the management and all the staff. You are wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lynz001
Reviews.Content: We called hotel direct and received great price of 119.00 which included leaving our car for 8 days and then staying at hotel on our return and shuttle to and from the airport. When we arrived we went in to get ticket for the car and to arrange shuttle to airport. The shuttle was already to go so no waiting. When we returned we called for free on the hotel phone board at the airport for the shuttle and waited about 10 minutes which was fine. We checked in and went to our room and found it very clean! The only thing I did not like decor wise was the color of the rug. We had a veiw of the golf course whcih was nice and 2 double beds non-smoking. We ate at Moxies and had a great meal in a lively place with lots of flat screen tv's, the staff was very friendly and the food was good. The tub was deep so I wanted to have a bath but could not get the plug to work so we called down for help. I did not wait as we watned to get going so I had a shower instead but someone did come within 10 minutes. I have stayed at most of the hotels and found for the price and location and it was quiet this was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great!”
Reviews.Author: LovesMist
Reviews.Content: We were staying in London, Ontario for a few days and decided to get a hotel closer to the Toronto airport our last night, in order to make it easier to catch our early flight. I read the reviews here on Trip Advisor and thought the Sandman Signature sounded wonderful and most reasonably priced! Here are a few things we found about the hotel that we did and didnâ€™t like. Some things are, of course, a matter of preference. CONS: 1. AC Unit is in the furthest corner of the room with furniture blocking its cooling ability. This also caused the bathroom to remain rather warm. 2. The room is VERY dimly lit even with all the lights on. The lamp at the work desk has an energy saving 60 watt equivalent fluorescent bulb. If we had been there on a business trip, needing to read documents and such, it would have been very difficult. The best lighting was over the beds. 3. There was no ice bag in the ice bucket. Not sure if this is by their choice or the maid just forgot. It was late when we arrived and did not bother to call and request one. 4. There was no signage as to where the ice machine or vending area was. The hotel is new and they might not have gotten around to putting it up yet. When we found it, it was in an area of the hall with three rooms right across from it. We were glad not to have gotten one of those rooms. (see pic) 5. The remote for the television was not fully functional. It would not change channels. 6. We requested an early wake up call. When the phone rang we tried to answer the phone next to the bed. It was then that we realized it had no cord and did not work. 7. The showerhead, though nice, sprayed a wide angleâ€¦so much so, that when I turned it on from outside the tub, it sprayed me, as well as the toilet and floor. 8. The tub wall is VERY tall to step over when getting out of the shower. 9. When we checked out, we mentioned that there were some minor problems with the room, the ladies at the front desk just smiled and did not ask any further questions. PROS: 1. The room looked nice and was clean. 2. The bathroom has a wall mounted, lighted make-up mirror. 3. Plenty of towels already in the bathroom and they were very soft and absorbent. 4. Bed, bedding and linens were very comfortable!!! 5. There is a safe available for use in the closet. 6. It is close to the airport, yet we only heard one plane fly over. BOTH: 1. The drapery allowed light to enter the room in the morning. Personally, I like it because it helps me wake up. My boyfriend prefers total darkness, so as not to be awakened by the intruding light early in the morning. 2. It has free WIRED internet connection in the room. So we couldnâ€™t both be on our computers at the same time. However, free internet is good. For the price and convenience, this hotel is not a bad choice. They have done many of the main things wellâ€¦ a clean room and comfortable bed. Itâ€™s just that they didnâ€™t seem to pay attention to detail. When we have the need to stay in the area again, we will probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: njabbott
Reviews.Content: Quite simply the best airport hotel in which I have stayed. It is modern, clean, well equipped with excellent staff. However, I would advise avoiding the restaurant if you value quality over convenience. I had a New York Strip that was ruined by a foul over spiced "Burgundy Rub." They simply seemed to try to fancy things up too much rather than take good ingredients and cook them simply and well. The good news is that there is are numerous restaurants within walking distance including an Outback (not bad) and a Keg (outstanding) I will always try to stay here if I have to night stop through Toronto again and I will look for Sandman Signature hotels elsewhere too.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay at the Sandman”
Reviews.Author: STozer89
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the sandman the night before our flight to punta cana. We parked and had shuttles to/from the airport for free. This hotel is very upscale. The lobby is all slate tile with 8 flat screen tv's. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. At checkin, the room we were given was occupied, then the next room we were given the keys didnt work...and then the 3rd time was a charm. The girl at the front desk was very apologetic. The room are beautifully decorated. The furniture was comfortable and there was plently of lighting. The air conditioner worked awesome. And the king bed and pillows were to die for. Also, have Moxies restaurant in the hotel was a HUGE bonus. The food was excellent and the staff were friendly. We honestly dont have anything bad to say about this hotel. We are planning to stay time after time when in toronto. Cant beat the prices either !

Reviews.Title: “Sweet dreams at the Sandman!”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Ha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on March 26th for a stopover on our way to Cuba. 2 rooms - 1 with the 2 queen beds (for 4 adults) and an Elite King room (which included a full kitchen) First impressions - Contacted the hotel over the phone several times to confirm details - staff is superb. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly, check in was very professional and friendly. This is what customer service SHOULD be! Hotel was easy to find, and parking is directly out front, and was very easy to access. Lobby is BEAUTIFUL, very chic, and well appointed. Front desk staff was great, check in was a breeze. Loved the â€˜marketâ€™ area that had snack and sundry items available at all times. There was a small bistro/coffee area that was closed at the time we departed. (4am) Halls and common areas â€“ very nice. Moxieâ€™s restaurant is great â€“ and check out the restroomsâ€¦my husband wants one at home!! Rooms were beautifully appointed, and with 4 adults with full gamut of luggage for a 1 week holiday was a little cramped, but not bad overall. We had a balcony, which offered a view north of the hotel, and overlooked the parking lot, so we could see our car. The other room with the kitchenette was awesome as wellâ€¦.would have been a great option for an extended and/or business stay. If I had to pick on something â€“ I would say the pillows are a little too large for my liking. (pretty hard to even find something to complain about!) I would, and have recommended this property to anyone!!!!! I just hope the prices donâ€™t jump too much!!!!

Reviews.Title: “whats not to like”
Reviews.Author: chaz w
Reviews.Content: i stay there once a week an had always stayed at a some what like establishment, but the service kindness and great attitude of all employees i have come across has won me over. to be honest i sleep here as well if not better than at home. as a travel agent when booking toronto this hotel will be at the top of the list thanks for everything Ricci,Samantha and especially Munir

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter4321
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sandman for 3 nights in February. I chose it because it was close to the airport and had a free shuttle. The shuttle was a while in picking us up but very punctual for taking us back. A nice modern, stylish hotel with a very good free business centre with computer and printer. Being able to check in online and print boarding passes when away from home is such a great help. But best of all was Moxy's the restaurant attached. The menu was excellent as was the food. We ate there every night, not having to go searching for good food was also a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlie-moore
Reviews.Content: I just had to write a review of this hotel. I can't say enough good about our stay here, we left our car here for one week and then arrived back late in the evening they instructed us to just call for a specific taxi, and they payed for the cab fair. also they shuttled us over to catch our flight. The room was beautiful, and the beds were very comfortable. Our car was left there , in there safe parking lot. This Hotel is wonderfull, the staff are great, and they even have a bowl of fresh green apples they give out. I have stayed in airport stop over hotels before but this place is by far the nicest I have ever stayed at. Your won't be disappointed with this place, hope this helps. Charlie Moore

Reviews.Title: “It Was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AndiForker
Reviews.Content: The Sandman is a perfect place to stay at the airport. The beds are so comfortable, the towels really big and fluffy, the rooms well-designed. Loved the TVs and wireless internet access. It was one of the most comfortable hotels I have ever stayed in--a perfect place to be while awaiting a flight. My only tiny complaint was that I asked the man at the front desk what my options were in terms of transportation downtown, as I wanted to do a few hours of sight-seeing, and he told me that the only way to get downtown was a taxi, which ended up costing $75. I figured out my own way back to the hotel via a short subway and bus ride, which was $2.75 and only took about one hour. It was simple if you do not have a lot of luggage en tote and I wish the guy at the front desk had told me about it. I would certainly stay at the hotel again though, in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sundial48
Reviews.Content: Even though we arrived early in the morning (3 am) and our stay was short... the hotel room was "Totally Awesome"!!! It was like being at home... only we didn't have to make the beds!! lol lol Would & will recommend the Sandman Signature Hotel to all!!!! Thank you and we'll see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “First class airport area hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oceanne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sandman after a 17 days trip in Canada, catching a flight early morning to the US. I then highly appreciated the in-suite washer and drier - which did a fantastic job even with delicate stuff ;-). Brand new, so spotless facilities, super comfortable bed, and quality linens and towels. Great views on the airport and airplanes to put you in the mood ;-) for the day after (although the day after, a -US?- Homeland Security Officer rude and outrageous ruined my departure and caused flight delay) Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay....”
Reviews.Author: SDTravelerSD
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an 8 day stay in Toronto. We booked our stay at the Sandman Signature Suites through Travelocity and got a great deal with airfare. LOCATION: The hotel is only a 5 minute drive from Pearson International Airport which made it very convenient. We were approx. 20/30 minutes from downtown Toronto (traffic! can be horrible, however) and 20 minutes to the Mississauga area. Convenient highway access. Watch your speed around hotel area....we saw police everyday pulling cars over all day long throughout our stay. LOBBY & FRONT DESK: The lobby was WOW. Beautiful tile floors, decorated very contemporary with flat screen tvs, plush rugs, great artwork. Nice intimate feel. Lobby has microwave available and a small store for odds and ins. The hotel was very empty during our stay which was great! The hotel has only been open for a few months so a lot of the floors are still under construction. The restaurant is not open yet but the hotel is offering complimentary muffins, croissants, coffee and juice in the morning. The service at the front desk was great. There were at least 3 working at all shifts and everyone was eager to give directions, say hello, and just make you feel welcome. PARKING: We parked right in front of the hotel for FREE. Never a search for a spot. Great! ROOMS: Decorated in dark brown - our room had two queen beds with brown suade bedspread, huge pillows. Flat screen tv, FREE cable internet access in room, small dining table by window, coffee maker, FREE bottled water, great bathroom towels, and bath products. Nice closet and dresser for storage. Space is a little tight between bed and dresser/tables. Bathroom has a large bathtub with shower-great water pressure. Not much counter space in bathroom. FREE perks -please keep them free!: Parking, internet in room OVERALL: We would love to stay here again. Nice boutique style hotel. Decor reminded us of the W hotels just on a smaller scale. A great place to come back to after a long day.
